title: Designing Movement-Based Learning with a Constraints-Led Approach: Founded on Nonlinear Pedagogy

context.prior_knowledge: Motor learning theory, foundational pedagogical knowledge, and practical experience in sports science or related fields
context.additional_context: Program for In-Service Practitioners Focused on Acquiring Non-Linear Design Methods Applicable to Real-World Physical Learning Environments

learning_goals: Evaluate the ability to design constraint-based motor learning environments
Develop personalized training programs for individual learners by applying nonlinear pedagogical principles
Understand the concept of representative learning design and apply it to practical cases
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
